Leong Wen Fong, Economics and Management at University of LondonLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 03 Dec 2018If you are able to, the best way is to live with your family. You get to spend time with them, watch your grandkids grow up, help them save costs by looking after themIf this isn't an option, and you are tied up financially, then going to an elderly care would make the most sense- basiacally there are trained professionals there, you can also make friends etc. The main downside is that you have to adhere to their schedules and rules and timetable.If you can afford it on the other hand, you can always stay in the flat and hire a personal helper for yourself. Expensive, but more personalised at least.0 comments2
